intro: Cypselea rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered cypselea, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, red-pink flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in open grasslands and along coastal areas, adapting well to coastal conditions. Cypselea rubriflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
